about_the_game:
Welcome to the doodle world! Armed with nothing but a pencil, play as Stickman as you explore a brand-new world. Solve intricate puzzles by drawing into the game, meet new friends while dodging scribble monsters, and make memories that’ll never be erased!

Draw is a 2D sidescroller–an artistic story-rich journey of grief and acceptance through the doodles of Nathan, a high schooler dealing with the grief of a recently lost friend.

As “Stickman,” you will navigate a lined-paper world of fun puzzles and doodle monsters. You’ll encounter different characters representing unique individuals in Nathan’s life who play a vital role in his journey of self-sabotage, isolation, depression, acceptance, and recovery.

In creating Draw, we set out to tell a meaningful and impactful story through simple artistic means, drawing heavily from the art style of iconic stick-figure fighting Flash games popular in the late 2000s. Taking inspiration from indie devs in the past who have tackled heavy and emotional topics with maturity and thoughtfulness despite their limited creative and programming resources, we hope to pay tribute to them in our own way through Draw.

This game contains mature themes/topics that may be upsetting to some viewers.

Features

  • 1-2 hours of total gameplay with 600+ lines of dialog
  • Draw with your mouse to create objects that interact with the environment
  • An original soundtrack featuring 9 songs
  • Explore over 30 different puzzles with 3 unique object physics
  • 30 different hand-drawn animations and cutscenes
  • Visual novel-style cutscenes deep-diving into the characters' lives

Welcome to the doodle world! Armed with nothing but a pencil, play as Stickman as you explore a brand-new world. Solve intricate puzzles by drawing into the game, meet new friends while dodging scribble monsters, and make memories that’ll never be erased!

Draw is a 2D sidescroller–an artistic story-rich journey of grief and acceptance through the doodles of Nathan, a high schooler dealing with the grief of a recently lost friend.

As “Stickman,” you will navigate a lined-paper world of fun puzzles and doodle monsters. You’ll encounter different characters representing unique individuals in Nathan’s life who play a vital role in his journey of self-sabotage, isolation, depression, acceptance, and recovery.

In creating Draw, we set out to tell a meaningful and impactful story through simple artistic means, drawing heavily from the art style of iconic stick-figure fighting Flash games popular in the late 2000s. Taking inspiration from indie devs in the past who have tackled heavy and emotional topics with maturity and thoughtfulness despite their limited creative and programming resources, we hope to pay tribute to them in our own way through Draw.

This game contains mature themes/topics that may be upsetting to some viewers.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Mojave 10.14 or newer
  • Processor: Apple M1 or Intel Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Storage: 512 MB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Mojave 10.14 or newer
  • Processor: Apple M1 or Intel Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Storage: 512 MB available space

name: Draw

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7 or newer
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 10
  • Storage: 512 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10 or newer
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 512 MB available space

short_description: Welcome to the world of Draw, a 2D sidescroller and visual novel! Armed with nothing but a pencil, play as “Stickman” as you explore a brand-new world. Solve puzzles by drawing into the game, meet new friends while dodging scribble monsters, and make memories that’ll never be erased!
supported_languages: English, Simplified Chinese, French, German, Spanish - Spain, Spanish - Latin America, Traditional Chinese, Japanese, Polish
